org.factcenter.qilin.primitives

Interface PseudorandomGenerator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlockCipherPRG

    public interface PseudorandomGenerator
    A pseudorandom generator. The interface is mostly copied from SCAPI for compatibility

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void generateKey()
      Generates a secret key and uses it to initialize this prg object.
      java.lang.String getAlgorithmName() 
      void getPRGBytes(byte[] outBytes, int outOffset, int outlen)
      Streams the prg bytes.
      boolean isKeySet()
      An object trying to use an instance of prg needs to check if it has already been initialized with a key.
      void reset()
      Reset the PRG (without changing the key).
      void setKey(byte[] secretKey)
      Sets the secret key for this prg.
      void setKey(javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
      For compatibility with SCAPI

    • Method Detail

      • setKey

        void setKey(byte[] secretKey)
        Sets the secret key for this prg. If the key is too short, it is zero-padded at the end. The key can be changed at any time.
        Parameters:
        secretKey - secret key

      • setKey

        void setKey(javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
     throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        For compatibility with SCAPI
        Parameters:
        secretKey -
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException

      • isKeySet

        boolean isKeySet()
        An object trying to use an instance of prg needs to check if it has already been initialized with a key.
        Returns:
        true if the object was initialized by calling the function setKey.

      • getAlgorithmName

        java.lang.String getAlgorithmName()
        Returns:
        the algorithm name. For example - AES

      • getPRGBytes

        void getPRGBytes(byte[] outBytes,
                 int outOffset,
                 int outlen)
        Streams the prg bytes.
        Parameters:
        outBytes - - output bytes. The result of streaming the bytes.
        outOffset - - output offset
        outlen - - the required output length

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset the PRG (without changing the key). This will bring the internal state to the same point as calling setKey with the currently set key.

      • generateKey

        void generateKey()
        Generates a secret key and uses it to initialize this prg object.
